title: Sernik (Polish Baked Cheesecake)
description: A rich, dense baked cheesecake made with farmer's cheese, featuring a delicate crumb and traditional flavor - the centerpiece of Polish holiday tables.
instructions: Preheat oven to 160°C (320°F). Grease 9-inch springform pan and line with parchment.
For crust: Mix crushed cookies, melted butter, and sugar. Press firmly into bottom of pan. Chill.
Press farmer's cheese through fine sieve or food mill twice for ultra-smooth texture.
In large bowl, beat softened butter with sugar and vanilla sugar until light and fluffy, about 5 minutes.
Add egg yolks one at a time, beating well after each. Mix in lemon zest, lemon juice, and vanilla.
Add sieved cheese in three additions, mixing until smooth after each.
Sift in potato starch and flour, mix until just combined.
In clean bowl with clean beaters, whip egg whites with salt until stiff peaks form.
Gently fold egg whites into cheese mixture in three additions, being careful not to deflate.
Pour batter over crust and smooth top. Tap pan gently to remove air bubbles.
Bake for 70-90 minutes until golden and set but still slightly wobbly in center.
Turn off oven, open door slightly, and let cheesecake cool completely in oven (about 2 hours).
Dust with powdered sugar or add lemon glaze and berries before serving.
